—

csrf_protect#

core.views.csrf_protect(view_func)#

This decorator adds CSRF protection in exactly the same way as CsrfViewMiddleware, but it can be used on a per view basis. Using both, or using the decorator multiple times, is harmless and efficient.

Assinatura: (view_func)

Descrição:

This decorator adds CSRF protection in exactly the same way as CsrfViewMiddleware, but it can be used on a per view basis. Using both, or using the decorator multiple times, is harmless and efficient.

—

financeira_data#

core.views.financeira_data(request)[código fonte]#

Retorna dados financeiros em formato JSON reutilizando a mesma lógica empregada pela API de Organograma. Toda a computação é delegada à função financeira_data_real, garantindo consistência e eliminando a antiga API simulada.

Assinatura: (request)

Descrição:

Retorna dados financeiros em formato JSON reutilizando a mesma lógica empregada pela API de Organograma. Toda a computação é delegada à função financeira_data_real, garantindo consistência e eliminando a antiga API simulada.

—

login#

core.views.login(request, user, backend=None)[código fonte]#

Persist a user id and a backend in the request. This way a user doesn’t have to reauthenticate on every request. Note that data set during the anonymous session is retained when the user logs in.

Assinatura: (request, user, backend=None)

Descrição:

Persist a user id and a backend in the request. This way a user doesn’t have to reauthenticate on every request. Note that data set during the anonymous session is retained when the user logs in.

—

redirect#

core.views.redirect(to, *args, permanent=False, **kwargs)[código fonte]#

Return an HttpResponseRedirect to the appropriate URL for the arguments passed.

The arguments could be:

  • A model: the model’s get_absolute_url() function will be called.

  • A view name, possibly with arguments: urls.reverse() will be used to reverse-resolve the name.

  • A URL, which will be used as-is for the redirect location.

Issues a temporary redirect by default; pass permanent=True to issue a permanent redirect.

Assinatura: (to, *args, permanent=False, **kwargs)

Descrição:

Return an HttpResponseRedirect to the appropriate URL for the arguments passed.

The arguments could be:

  • A model: the model’s get_absolute_url() function will be called.

  • A view name, possibly with arguments: urls.reverse() will be used to reverse-resolve the name.

  • A URL, which will be used as-is for the redirect location.

Issues a temporary redirect by default; pass permanent=True to issue a permanent redirect.

—

Return an HttpResponse whose content is filled with the result of calling django.template.loader.render_to_string() with the passed arguments.

Assinatura: (request, template_name, context=None, content_type=None, status=None, using=None)

Descrição:

—

render_to_string#

core.views.render_to_string(template_name, context=None, request=None, using=None)[código fonte]#

Load a template and render it with a context. Return a string.

template_name may be a string or a list of strings.

Assinatura: (template_name, context=None, request=None, using=None)

Descrição:

Load a template and render it with a context. Return a string.

template_name may be a string or a list of strings.

—

require_http_methods#

core.views.require_http_methods(request_method_list)[código fonte]#

Decorator to make a view only accept particular request methods. Usage:

@require_http_methods(["GET", "POST"])
def my_view(request):
    # I can assume now that only GET or POST requests make it this far
    # ...

Note that request methods should be in uppercase.

Assinatura: (request_method_list)

Descrição:

Decorator to make a view only accept particular request methods. Usage:

@require_http_methods(["GET", "POST"])
def my_view(request):
    # I can assume now that only GET or POST requests make it this far
    # ...

Note that request methods should be in uppercase.

—

update_session_auth_hash#

core.views.update_session_auth_hash(request, user)[código fonte]#

Updating a user’s password logs out all sessions for the user.

Take the current request and the updated user object from which the new session hash will be derived and update the session hash appropriately to prevent a password change from logging out the session from which the password was changed.

Assinatura: (request, user)

Descrição:

Updating a user’s password logs out all sessions for the user.

Take the current request and the updated user object from which the new session hash will be derived and update the session hash appropriately to prevent a password change from logging out the session from which the password was changed.
